intro: Jacquinia berteroi var. retusa, commonly known as the smooth jacquinia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in pine forests or open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
